name: Taiwan Mahjong Sh?ubù Q?
description:
Taiwan Mahjong Sh?ubù Q? is a mahjong simulation which follows traditional Taiwanese rules. Unlike most other variants, which traditionally feature hands of 13 tiles, Taiwanese rules notably feature hands of 16 tiles and this rule is prominently featured in this game.

The focus of this game is its tournament mode which pits the player against a large number of simulated opponents. The outcomes of all of the games are simulated, not just the player character, with AI players also being eliminated or rising in the ranks as appropriate. A single match mode is also available, and players can choose any three AI players to play against in this mode. Players are also given a detailed set of several dozen rule options to tweak gameplay to their liking.

shot.caption: Choosing a character. This is tournament mode, so our opponents are chosen for us.
The initial tournament bracket. Out of these eight players, only one can win!
The first round was all CPU players, so we get to see the results right away. The darkend square in the lower right is us!
Starting a round. We're playing west here.
Cut-ins show your opponents getting upset with you if you take too long to make a move.
North gets a chow off our discard. There are cut-ins showing player reactions whenever a player gets a pung or chow.
We get to choose which tiles to form our chow with; there's three different bamboo characters we could work off.
End of round; north just called mahjong.
The options menu features a variety of rule settings to tweak.
